title: Dotacty Drop Pouch Sub Abdominal Carrying Kit Bag Utility Tool Sack Fanny Pack Admin Dangler Pouch for Duty Vest Tactical Carrier Chest Rig
features: A horizontal "fanny pack" pouch for tactical vest which is constructed out of high quality 500D Cordura nylon. Thick, durable & wear-resistant. YKK smooth&solid zippers and decent stitching. Two elastic bands at the bottom of the pouch can be used to secure the tourniquet when the pouch is full. Height 4 3/4" x Width 9 2/5" x Depth 2 1/3". Weight: 0.27lb. Large enough to carry things at the lower part of your vest while at the range, but not so big that itâ€™s in the way.

A large waterproof zipper opening with dual zipper pulls allows quick and easy access to your items. It's located in the upper middle of the pouch like the zipper of a fanny pack, even if the zipper is fully open items are not easy to fall out. Horizontal oriented laser-cut MOLLE loop panel on the front for contents-identification patch purposes. You can also insert some stick-shaped items with clips such as pens in the MOLLE slots.

The top Velcro attachment for mounting on the range belt is not too wide or too long and also holds securely to the tactical vest. Note: The front of Velcro attachment panel of this pouch is a soft velro and the back side is hard velcro. It should be the OPPOSITE of the Velcro on the part connected to your carrier.

Designed to fit onto the bottom of chest rig or any other plate tactical carrier or rig that accommodates standard hook and loop, for training and recreational purposes. Even they're interchangeable and you don't have to constantly repack your bag. It can also be used as a hip pack with an inner belt that has soft Velcro on the outside and a gun belt that has hard Velcro on the inside. Great little accessory to add to your kit. Convenient pouch to hold important or regulary needed gear.

Versatile sundries pouch: A carry-on pouch on vest, an additional abdomen pouch to add to chest rig. EDC hip pouch to hold phone, wallet, multitool, ear plugs, and a cat tourniquet. An admin pouch for pencil, gloves, glow sticks, pens, note books, batteries, speed loaders, radios for out in the field. An IFAK pouch to store compression bandage, gauze pack, trauma shears, even a small first aid bag. A dump pouch to carry mags, chem lights, zip ties etc.
